remarks: If the catheti of two right-angled triangles are congruent, so is their hypothenuse.  Theorem 10.12 of [Schwabhauser] p. 91.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 16-Dec-2019.)
statement:
hypcgr.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
hypcgr.m $e |- .- = ( dist ` G ) $.
hypcgr.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
hypcgr.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
hypcgr.h $e |- ( ph -> G TarskiGDim>= 2 ) $.
hypcgr.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. P ) $.
hypcgr.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. P ) $.
hypcgr.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. P ) $.
hypcgr.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. P ) $.
hypcgr.e $e |- ( ph -> E e. P ) $.
hypcgr.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. P ) $.
hypcgr.1 $e |- ( ph -> <" A B C "> e. ( raG ` G ) ) $.
hypcgr.2 $e |- ( ph -> <" D E F "> e. ( raG ` G ) ) $.
hypcgr.3 $e |- ( ph -> ( A .- B ) = ( D .- E ) ) $.
hypcgr.4 $e |- ( ph -> ( B .- C ) = ( E .- F ) ) $.
hypcgr $p |- ( ph -> ( A .- C ) = ( D .- F ) ) $.
